instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the estimation model on estimating chlorophyll content in soybean canopy leaves at different growth stages, and how well did it perform?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the estimation model on estimating chlorophyll content in soybean canopy leaves at different growth stages was the determination coefficient (R-2). The R-2 value measures the proportion of the variance in the chlorophyll content that can be explained by the model. In this study, the optimal estimation model during the R4 period had a validation set determination coefficient (R-2) of 0.854. This indicates that the model can explain approximately 85.4% of the variance in the chlorophyll content, suggesting a high level of accuracy.

instruction: How were the machine learning models used to establish the inversion model for chlorophyll content estimation in soybean crops at different growth stages in the related study?
Output:
In the related study, three machine learning methods were used to establish an inversion model for chlorophyll content estimation in soybean crops at different growth stages. The machine learning methods used were:

1. Support Vector Machine (SVM): SVM is a supervised learning algorithm that can be used for classification or regression tasks. In this study, SVM was used to establish an inversion model for chlorophyll content estimation at different growth stages of soybean crops.

instruction: Can the selected spectral indices and machine learning methods used in the related study be considered superior to traditional methods for estimating chlorophyll content in soybean crops at different growth stages?
Output:
